function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Fecal transmission routes and aerosol formation during wastewater treatment","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Possible airborne transmission of covid-19 in patient rooms","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Shortage of supply chain for critical ppe","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reliance on disinfection using chlorine-containing substances","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate evaluation of drug therapies for covid-19","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate evaluation of traditional medicinal plants for covid-19 treatment","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Promotion of unproven and potentially unsafe treatments for covid-19","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Misinformation and confusion about the efficacy of drugs for covid-19 treatment","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Delayed development and evaluation of safe and effective treatments","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Covid-19 as a global threat","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Presence of sars-cov-2 in untreated wastewater","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Survival of covid-19 in sewage and wastewater","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Insufficient comprehensive surveillance of the environment through air and water","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of rapid and on-site detection of covid-19 in sewage waters and humans","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on assumptions for modeling daily excretion rates in human stool samples","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Direct contact with wastewater containing microorganisms","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate supply of personal protective equipment ppe","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Global shortage of essential medical supplies","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Complexity of pcr determination","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Variety of concentration methods for wastewater","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Detection of sars-cov-2 rna in untreated wastewaters","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of pcr-based diagnosis in low sanitation countries","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increase in sars-cov-2 genetic loading in wastewater corresponding to active covid-19 cases","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reliance on qpcr as the method of choice for detecting sars-cov-2 in wastewater.","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on a single measurement solution for the rapid detection of covid-19 in sewage waters and humans.","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limitation to pcr-based methods for virus concentration and detection in wastewater.","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential risk of undetected sars-cov-2 in wastewater due to limitations in concentration and detection methods.","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of optimization for the entire protocol from sampling to detection/quantification may lead to inaccurate results and inefficient virus analysis.","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Significant issues identified for the virus quantitative analysis in wastewater and sludge matrices, indicating potential challenges in accurate virus detection and quantification in these complex environments.","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Utilization of advanced rna detection methods like crispr and dpcr for virus detection and quantification presents the risk of misinterpretation or inadequate understanding of the results compared to traditional methods like rt-qpcr.","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Complex microfluidic systems with interconnected networks may be prone to contamination and spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Low-cost mass production of loc-based devices may lead to compromised quality control and increased risk of device malfunction.","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Widespread use of loc-based techniques for viral detection may create false positives or false negatives in diagnostic results.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Development of lab-in-a-tube, lab-in-a-box, and lab on-a-drone systems for disease diagnosis","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Rapid development and deployment of poct systems for pandemic diagnosis","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Global emphasis on the need for rapid and sensitive detection techniques like biosensors","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential spread of influenza a h1n1 and human adenovirus","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential spread of sars-cov-2","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited understanding of biosensor terminology among environmental audience","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High lods for lassa fever, west nile fever, and influenza could lead to missed detection of the viruses in wastewater, increasing the risk of environmental contamination.","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Absence of a paper-based device to detect sars-cov-2 in wastewaters increases the risk of undetected viral presence in the environment and potential transmission.","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Complex matrix in wastewaters may interfere with biosensor detection, leading to inaccurate results and potential misinterpretation of viral presence.","category":"Structures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Endogenous biomarkers present in sewage systems can be used to estimate the real-time population served by the system, posing a risk of privacy invasion.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"The identification and monitoring of disease biomarkers in sewage systems could lead to the unintentional disclosure of health information of entire populations.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Proteomic identification of disease biomarkers in sewage systems may lead to the unintentional tracking and monitoring of health conditions of different populations, potentially violating privacy and ethical standards.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on pcr for detection of sars-cov-2 in wastewater","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of standardized evaluation and verification of rt-qpcr methods","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Complexity of wastewater matrix impacting detection methods","category":"Structures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Discrepancies between laboratories due to factors such as qpcr platforms, pcr inhibitors, nucleic acid extraction efficiency, and low levels of targets","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Large uncertainty in viral load in feces making it difficult to determine a typical value for wbe and comparison with clinical data","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"}]}
